Docs.summary:
The class is used to define the steps needed to perform a desired machine learning task.
The steps are defined by adding a data loader (e.g. ) followed by zero or more transforms (e.g. ) and at most one trainer/learner (e.g. ) in the pipeline.

member this.Train : unit -> Microsoft.ML.PredictionModel<'Input, 'Output (requires 'Input : null and 'Output : null and 'Output : (new : unit -> 'Output))> (requires 'Input : null and 'Output : null and 'Output : (new : unit -> 'Output))

Docs.typeparam:
Type of data instances the model will be trained on. It's a custom type defined by the user according to the structure of data.
Please see https://www.microsoft.com/net/learn/apps/machine-learning-and-ai/ml-dotnet/get-started/windows for more details on input type.

Ouput type. The prediction will be return based on this type. Please see https://www.microsoft.com/net/learn/apps/machine-learning-and-ai/ml-dotnet/get-started/windows for more details on output type.
Docs.summary: Train the model using the ML components in the pipeline.
Docs.returns: PredictionModel object. This is the model object used for prediction on new instances.
